author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Not-Your-Average Art Class is back
text:
Not-Your-Average Art Class is back Sep 28, 2015 Mark Kelly’s art class exercises include making simultaneous portraits. 
Rockland — Midcoast artist Mark Kelly will offer another round of his popular Not-Your-Average Art Class in October with RSU 13 Adult Education. The four-week program will run 6 to 7:30 p.m. Wednesdays, Oct. 7 through 28, at the McLain School Building on Lincoln Street. 
The class is open for people with all levels of experience. Kelly encourages folks to try different techniques and discuss their results as they explore the art process. Classes will build skills and strengthen confidence as students produce unconventional works with a wide variety of materials. 
Kelly, a founding partner of the former Åarhus Gallery in Belfast, is widely known for his images of birds, starling murmurations, found object art and use of unique art media such as gunpowder and fireworks. 
A $40 plus $10 materials fee covers all classes. Pre-registration is strongly encouraged; call 594-9764 to register for classes. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
